title.value: Annotation Cost-Sensitive Deep Active Learning with Limited Data (Student Abstract)
title.justification: The title is found at the beginning of the paper, before the abstract section.
title.quote: Annotation Cost-Sensitive Deep Active Learning with Limited Data (Student Abstract)

extractions.description: This paper explores cost-sensitive deep active learning, focusing on the trade-offs between annotation costs and accuracy. Using the MNIST dataset for experimental validation, the authors adapt strategies like MC Dropout and acquisition functions such as BALD to integrate annotation costs into active learning processes.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments using the MNIST dataset to validate the proposed methods.
type.quote: In this work we show how annotation cost can be considered and learned during active learning on a classification task on the MNIST dataset.

name.justification: The research focuses on active learning strategies tailored for cost-sensitive annotation processes.
name.quote: Active learning (AL) aims to alleviate this issue by reducing the required quantity of data to label by selecting the most informative sample within an unlabeled dataset.

name.justification: The research emulates the context of biomedical imaging for its experiments.
name.quote: Deep learning is a promising avenue to automate tedious analysis tasks in biomedical imaging.

name.justification: The study utilizes deep learning models specifically convolutional neural networks for experiments.
name.quote: Deep learning is a promising avenue to automate tedious analysis tasks in biomedical imaging.

name.justification: The paper mentions using a CNN model for predictions in the discussion of methods.
name.quote: We adapt the convolutional neural network (CNN) from Gal, Islam, and Ghahramani (2017) as the predictive model for this task.

is_contributed.justification: The CNN model is adapted from existing research and not contributed by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We adapt the convolutional neural network (CNN) from Gal, Islam, and Ghahramani (2017) as the predictive model for this task.

is_executed.justification: The CNN model is actively used to perform tasks in the experiment setup.
is_executed.quote: We adapt the convolutional neural network (CNN) from Gal, Islam, and Ghahramani (2017) as the predictive model for this task.

is_compared.justification: The CNN model is part of the evaluation against other methods through experiments using acquisition functions like BALD, Entropy, and STD.
is_compared.quote: We find that STD performs best, consistently requiring the least training images to reach an accuracy of 90% (Table 1).

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep Bayesian Active Learning with Image Data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper credits this work when mentioning the CNN as it references Gal, Islam, and Ghahramani (2017).
referenced_paper_title.quote: We adapt the convolutional neural network (CNN) from Gal, Islam, and Ghahramani (2017) as the predictive model for this task.

name.justification: The MNIST dataset is explicitly mentioned as the dataset used for experimental validation.
name.quote: synthetic classification task crafted using the MNIST dataset (Deng 2012).

referenced_paper_title.value: The MNIST database of handwritten digit images for machine learning research
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper includes a reference to Deng (2012) when discussing the MNIST dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: synthetic classification task crafted using the MNIST dataset (Deng 2012).
